Im thinking about reading the series, because I saw the first movie '2001 Space Odessey' and the second '2010 The Day We Make Contact'?

The whole series really intrigues me and I love the idea of deep space exploration. Oh and quick side note, yes I have seen Interstellar. (;
you go ahead good Sir, Clarke at his finest !
There's even more science in the books. A lot more detail that the movie sacrificed, like how much artificial gravity is in the Discovery's centrifuge.
Definitely worth reading. But avoid the 4 part - it's garbage.
Since these books are fictional spaceflight, the thread has been moved to the Lounge.
If only that vision of the future had been achieved. NASA had plans for that kind of thing to happen. They really knew how to dream. This series is awesome!

On 8/4/2016 at 8:30 AM, ISE said:

Im thinking about reading the series, because I saw the first movie '2001 Space Odessey' and the second '2010 The Day We Make Contact'?

The whole series really intrigues me and I love the idea of deep space exploration. Oh and quick side note, yes I have seen Interstellar. (;

While Clarke's original story underwent seven re-writes before evolving into 2001: A Space Odyssey, I would suggest you start with the original first - The Sentinel. It's a short story, a good primer, a seed if you will, and you'll finish it in a day.
